alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 4:49PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wayne County through 530 PM EDT... At 449 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Parnell, or near Monticello, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Monticello and Hidalgo around 505 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Steubenville, Cooper, Slickford, Oil Valley, Barrier, Coopersville, Burfield, Rockeybranch, Gregory and Denney. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
